valid_articles.Title: New tool to track your Google's AI Overviews Inclusion: ZipTie
valid_articles.Description: A new tool called ZipTie has been released that allows users to track their website's inclusion in Google's AI Overviews. The tool offers a 14-day free trial.

valid_articles.Title: Semrush Starts Providing Data for AI Overviews Inclusion
valid_articles.Description: Semrush has started providing data on AI Overviews inclusion in its sensor and position tracking tool. Currently, AI Overviews are only included in a small percentage of tracked SERPs.

valid_articles.Title: Google AI Overviews Inclusion Visible in Semrush Sensor
valid_articles.Description: Google AI Overviews inclusion is now visible in the Semrush sensor, showing inclusion in only 0.4% of desktop SERPs and 0.57% of mobile SERPs in the US. Inclusion rates vary by site category.

valid_articles.Title: Pew Research Center Study on Digital Decay
valid_articles.Description: A study by Pew Research Center found that about 38% of webpages that existed in 2013 are now unavailable, and 8% of pages from 2023 are unavailable. The study also found that 23% of news pages have at least one broken link.

valid_articles.Title: Google Hints at Improving Site Rankings in Next Update
valid_articles.Description: Google has announced that it aims to better reward high-quality content sites in its next core update.

valid_articles.Title: Microsoft Might Face EU Probe Over Bing AI Safety Concerns
valid_articles.Description: The EU Commission is investigating Bing's AI for safety risks, including deepfakes and manipulation. Microsoft could face fines for non-compliance.

valid_articles.Title: Microsoft Under $2.1 Billion Fine From EU Over Bing AI Risks
valid_articles.Description: Microsoft faces a potential $2 billion fine from the EU over concerns about misinformation and manipulation risks from Bing's AI features, such as Copilot.

valid_articles.Title: Microsoft faces multi-billion dollar fine in EU over Bing AI
valid_articles.Description: Microsoft faces a fine in the European Union of up to 1% of its annual revenue if it doesn't respond to a request for information by May 27. The threat stems from a request made under the E.U.'s Digital Services Act concerning the company's Bing search engine and its associated generative artificial intelligence features.

valid_articles.Title: Microsoft faces multibillion-dollar fine in EU over Bing AI
valid_articles.Description: Microsoft has a May 27 deadline to respond to a European Commission request for information concerning its Bing artificial intelligence services.

valid_articles.Title: Perplexity CEO Criticizes Google's AI Search UI
valid_articles.Description: Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas has criticized Google's AI search user interface, calling it "a mess" and "pretty complicated."

valid_articles.Title: LinkedIn's Collaborative Articles Impacted by Google's Algorithm
valid_articles.Description: LinkedIn's collaborative articles, which begin with AI content and allow users to add their own contributions, have been negatively impacted by Google's algorithm updates.

valid_articles.Title: OpenAI Dissolves Team Focused on Long-Term AI Risks
valid_articles.Description: OpenAI has dissolved its Superalignment team, which was focused on mitigating long-term risks associated with artificial intelligence.

valid_articles.Title: Google's Helpful Content System Integrated into Core Algorithm
valid_articles.Description: Google's helpful content system has been integrated into its core algorithm, indicating that site-level algorithms play a role in assessing content helpfulness.

valid_articles.Title: Women in Tech SEO Festival Returns to Philadelphia
valid_articles.Description: The Women in Tech SEO Festival is returning to Philadelphia on September 19th, 2024.

valid_articles.Title: Microsoft Makes Bing Default Search Engine in PC Manager Cleanup
valid_articles.Description: Microsoft has added Bing as the default search engine in its PC Manager cleanup tool, as part of an effort to improve PC health.

valid_articles.Title: EU Demands Clarity from Microsoft on AI Risks in Bing
valid_articles.Description: The European Commission could fine Microsoft if it doesn't provide adequate information on risks stemming from generative AI features in search engine Bing by May 27.

valid_articles.Description: The European Commission has moved to "compel" Microsoft to provide information about generative artificial intelligence (AI) risks on its Bing search engine, threatening it with a fine, according to a statement on Friday (17 May).

valid_articles.Description: The EU wants Microsoft to furnish it with Bing's internal data so that it can access its generative AI risks on electoral processes.

valid_articles.Title: European Union Directs Microsoft To Provide More Information on Generative AI Features in Its Search Engine ‘Bing’ or Face Fine
valid_articles.Description: The European Commission has directed Microsoft to provide more information about the generative AI features in its search engine Bing or face a fine. The tech giant failed to respond to a March 14 request for inputs regarding specific risks stemming from Bing's GenAI features.

valid_articles.Title: EU Commission gives Microsoft 10 days to hand over Bing AI documents
valid_articles.Description: The European Commission has given Microsoft a legally binding deadline of May 27 to supply documents concerning the use of generative artificial intelligence (AI) in its Bing search engine. The order concerns two features: "Copilot in Bing," a multipurpose system that can create text and images based on prompts from the user, and "Image Creator."
